passages.text: First Take: 2Q25 beat in PCPO and profits

2Q25 - beat, with \(\mathsf{P}\mathsf{P}\mathsf{O}\mathsf{P} + 24\%\) y/y and profits \(+5\%\) y/y, beating JPMe by 19ppt/4ppt. Key positives include NIM stabilization, strong non- NII growth and improved cost management. Key negatives include asset quality deterioration with sequential rise of SML ratio by 14bps q/q and decline in NPL coverage ratio by 6ppt. We expect a positive share price reaction near term. However, as AQ risk persisted, we remain Neutral.

- NIM contraction is moderating: 2Q25 NIM -2bps q/q to \(1.69\%\) moderating from -9bps q/q in 1Q25. Management expects deposits repricing (of lower rates) to ease NIM pressure; if market rate stabilizes, then NIM should be able to stay at 2Q level.

- Non-NII continues to be strong: 2Q fee growth \(+16\%\) y/y, up from \(+9\%\) y/y in 1Q. Strong fee growth was driven by corporate banking business, custodian and wealth business (Table 7). Non-fee income \(+27\%\) y/y.

- 2Q OPEX -10% y/y: This is due partly to reduction in deposits agency fee effective Jul 2024 and Jan 2025. If we assume deposits agency fee rate is the same as 1H24, then OPEX growth would be \(+3\%\) in 1H25 vs reported -7% y/y.
- Capital: CET 1 ratio \(+131\) bps q/q, due to Rmb130bn of capital injection in 2Q with 21% dilution.

- Worsening AQ with reduction in NPL coverage ratio: NPL and SML ratio increased by 1bp and 14bps q/q to \(0.92\%\) and \(1.21\%\) , respectively. ManagementSaid NPL formation rates for retail consumption loans and personal business loans have declined, but the rise in both SML and NPL ratios indicate other retail loan subsectors are seeing elevated pressure. NPL ratio for corporate reduced by 5bps h/h, while retail \(+10\) bps h/h; please see Table 4 for details. NPL coverage ratio reduced by 6ppt q/q to \(260\%\) . Loan loss reserve was reduced by 2bps to \(2.40\%\) .
- Income tax rose by \(288\%\) y/y or \(254\%\) q/q. While there is no clear explanation for the rise, we think it is likely due to decline in deferral or deductible items.
- We expect upward revision of consensus earnings by low single digit
1658.HK,1658 HK Price: HK\$5.41 29 Aug 2025 Price Target: HK\$5.30 PT End Date: 31 Dec 2026
·We expect PSBC's share price to go up.

Investment Thesis- In our view, PSBC should benefit indirectly more from the small bank reforms than other SOE banks.- Asset quality under pressure: PSBC reported a rise in NPL ratio and SML ratio, meaning its asset quality trend is worse than peers. As PSBC has the highest exposure to inclusive finance, its asset quality may be under pressure for several quarters even with moderate macro recovery.- Higher dilution impact from capital raising: PSBC saw the highest dilution impact among the four SOE banks from its announced capital raising in March 2025. We estimate dilution to 25E EPS/DPS/ROCE are \(-9.6\% / - 14.7\% / - 65\) bps.

Our Dec- 26 PT of HK\\$5.30 is based on a dividend discount model (DDM), using a cost of equity of \(11.3\%\) , normalized ROE of \(8.5\%\) and terminal date of 31 December 2027. Details are summarized in the valuation table below.
Source: J.P. Morgan estimates.
Key assumptions/parametersNormalized ROE8.5%Cost of capital11.3%Long-term growth4.5%Fair terminal P/BV0.56Dec-26 H-share PT (HK$)5.30

The chart(s) show J.P. Morgan's continuing coverage of the stocks; the current analysts may or may not have covered it over the entire period.
J.P. Morgan ratings or designations: \(\mathrm{OW} =\) Overweight, \(\mathrm{N} =\) Neutral, \(\mathrm{UW} =\) Underweight, \(\mathrm{NR} =\) Not Rated

J.P. Morgan uses the following rating system: Overweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will outperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); Neutral (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will perform in line with the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); and Underweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe). NR is Not Rated. In this case, J.P. Morgan has removed the rating and, if applicable, the price target, for this stock because of either a lack of a sufficient fundamental basis or for legal, regulatory or policy reasons. The previous rating and, if applicable, the price target, no longer should be relied upon. An NR designation is not a recommendation or a rating. In Americas equity research, some stocks under coverage have a rating but no price target; in these cases, we expect the stock will outperform/perform in line/underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe over the next six to 12 months. In our Asia (ex-Australia and ex-India) and U.K. small- and mid-cap Equity Research, each stock's expected total return is compared to the expected total return of a benchmark country market index, not to those Research Analysts' coverage universe. If it does not appear in the Important Disclosures section of this report, the certifying Research Analyst's coverage universe can be found on J.P. Morgan's Research website, https://www.jpmorganmarkets.com.
